update.description:
Updated ogre1.x and ogre 2.1 implementation to generate XYZ RGB point clouds in addition to depth.

The original implementation generated depth data in shaders and pack the result in a single channel 32 bit float texture. This is now changed to a four channel 32 bit float texture which packs `[x, y, z, rgba]` data. Note the last `rgba` field is encoded by four 8 bit r, g, b, a values. With these four fields, we can populate the point cloud msg with XYZ and RGB data, as well as color and depth image msgs.

While working on the ogre2 implementation, I found a major bug with the depth data values. The data generated are actually ‘range’ not ‘depth’. It’s now fixed.

See below for a results produced by a RgbdCameraSensor \(which uses ign-rendering DepthCamera\).

**Before**: notice the curved lines on the ground and the jersey barrier is rotated

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/1071464591-pointCloud_before.png)
‌

**After**: The lines are now straight and the jersey barrier orientation is correct.

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/3672754229-pointCloud_after.png)
update.title: Support generating point cloud data in DepthCamera

content.raw:
it has a complaint about source compatibility that looks like a false positive to me on closer inspection

Added symbol:

~~~
$ c++filt
_ZN8ignition9rendering2v215OgreDepthCamera18UpdateRenderTargetESt10shared_ptrINS1_17OgreRenderTextureEEPN4Ogre8MaterialERKNSt7__cxx1112basic_stringIcSt11char_traitsIcESaIcEEE
ignition::rendering::v2::OgreDepthCamera::UpdateRenderTarget(std::shared_ptr<ignition::rendering::v2::OgreRenderTexture>, Ogre::Material*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)
~~~

Removed symbol:

~~~
$ c++filt
_ZN8ignition9rendering2v215OgreDepthCamera18UpdateRenderTargetENSt10shared_ptrINS1_17OgreRenderTextureEEEPN4Ogre8MaterialERKNSt7__cxx1112basic_stringIcEE 
ignition::rendering::v2::OgreDepthCamera::UpdateRenderTarget(std::shared_ptr<ignition::rendering::v2::OgreRenderTexture>, Ogre::Material*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char> const&)
~~~

with the difference being:

~~~
std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > 
std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>
~~~

so I think it's probably fine
content.html:
it has a complaint about source compatibility that looks like a false positive to me on closer inspection

Added symbol:

$ c++filt
_ZN8ignition9rendering2v215OgreDepthCamera18UpdateRenderTargetESt10shared_ptrINS1_17OgreRenderTextureEEPN4Ogre8MaterialERKNSt7__cxx1112basic_stringIcSt11char_traitsIcESaIcEEE
ignition::rendering::v2::OgreDepthCamera::UpdateRenderTarget(std::shared_ptr<ignition::rendering::v2::OgreRenderTexture>, Ogre::Material*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)

Removed symbol:

$ c++filt
_ZN8ignition9rendering2v215OgreDepthCamera18UpdateRenderTargetENSt10shared_ptrINS1_17OgreRenderTextureEEEPN4Ogre8MaterialERKNSt7__cxx1112basic_stringIcEE 
ignition::rendering::v2::OgreDepthCamera::UpdateRenderTarget(std::shared_ptr<ignition::rendering::v2::OgreRenderTexture>, Ogre::Material*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char> const&)

with the difference being:

std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > 
std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>

so I think it's probably fine

pullrequest.title: Support generating point cloud data in DepthCamera

content.raw: there is a [PreRender](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/1bc2ed0dd7f31cc44924331a2f713c41d3bd08bc/include/ignition/rendering/Object.hh#lines-58) base function so the ABI checker did not like it when I also defined a private `PreRender` function in the derived class. There is no`CreatePointCloudTexture` base function though
content.html: there is a PreRender base function so the ABI checker did not like it when I also defined a private PreRender function in the derived class. There is noCreatePointCloudTexture base function though

content.raw:
It might already be overriding the base function, since clang is complaining that it isn't using an `override` keyword:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/323/warnings10Result/

~~~
'PreRender' overrides a member function but is not marked 'override'
~~~
content.html:
It might already be overriding the base function, since clang is complaining that it isn't using an override keyword:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/323/warnings10Result/
'PreRender' overrides a member function but is not marked 'override'

update.description:
Updated ogre1.x and ogre 2.1 implementation to generate XYZ RGB point clouds in addition to depth.

The original implementation generated depth data in shaders and pack the result in a single channel 32 bit float texture. This is now changed to a four channel 32 bit float texture which packs `[x, y, z, rgba]` data. Note the last `rgba` field is encoded by four 8 bit r, g, b, a values. With these four fields, we can populate the point cloud msg with XYZ and RGB data, as well as color and depth image msgs.

While working on the ogre2 implementation, I found a major bug with the depth data values. The data generated are actually ‘range’ not ‘depth’. It’s now fixed.

See below for a results produced by a RgbdCameraSensor \(which uses ign-rendering DepthCamera\).

**Before**: notice the curved lines on the ground and the jersey barrier is rotated

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/1071464591-pointCloud_before.png)
‌

**After**: The lines are now straight and the jersey barrier orientation is correct.

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/3672754229-pointCloud_after.png)
